page.title: 10Cramlington:Education
page.content: In Cramlington there is one large High School for children from 13 to 18 years of age. It is a Comprehensive school, for there is no entry exam. Four Middle Schools for children from the ages of 9 to 13 send their children on to this school when they leave. The Middle Schools get their children from the ten First Schools, which take children from 5 to 9 years. Each Middle School usually gets children from two First Schools. Most First School children live within walking distance of school. All of the schools have been built since 1965, except Parkside Middle which was the old village elementary school.There are Roman Catholic First and Middle Schools.It is planned to build several new First and one new Middle School. Plans for a second High School are having to wait. Klondyke F.S.
